title: Package specs fail for yaml-cpp package when using namespaces
body:
I've created an external repo to override native packages in spack.
I can use the namespace to properly reference most packages, but yaml-cpp fails when I add the compiler in the spec.


### Steps to reproduce the issue
For example,
`spack find builtin.yaml-cpp`

returns the proper references, but

`spack find builtin.yaml-cpp%gcc@7.2.0`

returns

`==> Error: Spec filename must end in .yaml: 'builtin.yaml-cpp%gcc@7.2.0'`

The following also return the expected results:

`spack find builitin.nalu-wind%gcc@7.2.0`
`spack find builtin.trilinos%gcc@7.2.0`

So it appears to be an issue with yaml-cpp (as far as I know). Guessing it is because there is a "*.yaml" in the spec for this corner case.

Debug output:

[myconsole]$ spack -d find builtin.yaml-cpp%gcc%7.2.0
==> [2020-01-29-14:55:12.384485] Imported find from built-in commands
==> [2020-01-29-14:55:12.386274] Imported find from built-in commands
==> [2020-01-29-14:55:12.387341] SpackError: Spec filename must end in .yaml: 'builtin.yaml-cpp%gcc%7.2.0'
==> [2020-01-29-14:55:12.387410] Error: Spec filename must end in .yaml: 'builtin.yaml-cpp%gcc%7.2.0'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/projects/wind/snl-ceerws/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 711, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/projects/wind/snl-ceerws/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 456, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/projects/wind/snl-ceerws/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/find.py", line 197, in find
    results = args.specs(**q_args)
  File "/projects/wind/snl-ceerws/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/common/arguments.py", line 69, in _specs
    qspecs = spack.cmd.parse_specs(self.values)
  File "/projects/wind/snl-ceerws/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py", line 161, in parse_specs
    raise spack.error.SpackError(msg)
spack.error.SpackError: Spec filename must end in .yaml: 'builtin.yaml-cpp%gcc%7.2.0'

### Information on your system

RHEL6, custom package in repo that just allows me to access additional sha's for yaml-cpp, but inherits from yaml-cpp in builtin.  I don't think my package configuration has anything to do with this.
